tweets.text: #StormChristoph currently 2 @EnvAgencyYNE flood warnings & 3 alerts in place for #Leeds. Keep updated and informed at https://t.co/FjsUnQcPZe #PrepareActSurvive

Some sizeable and widespread rainfall totals so far for #Cumbria in the first wave of #StormChristoph. Honister Pass out in front as usual with 150mm. Pleasing that almost every one of our #Hydrometry raingauges appears to be working well! ü§û  @EnvAgencyNW @metoffice https://t.co/hA7lZVRvR5
@BBC_Cumbria How's botcherby bridge

Interesting article in @britwildlife re eradicating Mink in East Anglia: "Is Mink control for ever?". The answer is to assume probably yes. I set up a "cordon sanitaire" project in the SW with @BASCnews in 2010, but sadly funding not sustained long enough to clear the peninsula. https://t.co/2XE7J9r4lE

tweets.text: We currently have 10 flood alerts in place across the #NorthEast with flood gates closed in communities across the region, including #Morpeth and #Yarm - check the latest situation here: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/V1cv2vALyp

Get the latest flood info & sign up to receive flood warnings here: 
https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/tWxRI5w92Y

urls.description: If there is an immediate risk to your life or you are trapped by flood water call 999.

tweets.text:
üåßÔ∏è With #FloodWarnings and #FloodAlerts in place for parts of #Lancashire, watch our video for steps to stay safe before, during, and after a flood and see: https://t.co/8Oh91nEOml

Follow @EnvAgencyNW & @TheFloodHub for updates
#LancsAlert #StormChristoph https://t.co/jZHobb4Ds8

@EnvAgency are tracking significant rainfall nationally in the next 6-10 days. This will lead to floods. Please be ready for flooding. Sign up to flood warnings, move your insurance documents and memorabilia. Lift outside items now. Listen to local radio, act on flood warnings
Flood warnings have been issued for Shrewbridge Road, Nantwich, please visit @EnvAgency for full details https://t.co/kTZBA75BvU

@StephOckenden highlighted some work being done within @DefraGovUK!
- @EnvAgency restoration manuals (oyster reefs, Saltmarsh etc) and ReMeMaRe initiative - restoring meadows, marshes and reefs.
- @The_MMO regulatory systems for climate change!
#coastalfutures21 #oceanrecovery

tweets.text: Our thoughts are with @EnvAgency staff and other Cat 1 & 2 responders, voluntary organisations and community #volunteers responding to the impact of #StormChristoph and the communities that lie in its path. A very difficult start to 2021 but we look towards brighter times.

tweets.text:
‚ö†Ô∏è The county is covered by several @metoffice rain warnings today including a Amber warning for certain areas.

A risk of some rivers flooding as a result of today‚Äôs rainfall.

Keep up to date with the latest @EnvAgency River warnings here https://t.co/5xRmAfX37h https://t.co/OzKsPpA1Q0

It‚Äôs wet, wet, wet across the #Midlands today (Wednesday). Lots of surface water on roads. Please don‚Äôt drive through #flood water. 30cms is enough to float your car. Keep checking your #flood risk. Latest update here 
https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/fMneKq3b7w

An @EnvAgencyYNE flood warning is in force for Walsden Water. River levels across the Upper River Calder have risen and are now approaching levels where we expect properties to flood. Please take care and be prepared. Visit https://t.co/SOPqHGairw for advice. https://t.co/Xa21H6xf44
Great video by @stewart_mounsey and @EnvAgencyNW  of the entrance to a very important culvert for communities in east Kendal (Stockbeck East) https://t.co/00R6g5Gf7i
Thank you to @EnvAgencyNW for the ongoing funding, our many great partners including @lowthercastle, @cumbriawildlife, and Alison & Heather for the article https://t.co/jcU0XgvVLb

tweets.text:
#StormChristoph is continuing to bring heavy rain across England which can lead to #flooding. Check your flood risk and sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/O3zNENsUPo

Pictures from Carlisle's River Eden through Rickerby Park this morning. The river's well out of its channel and onto flood plain. The @EnvAgencyNW has a flood warning in place for the Eden in Rickerby Park, and the Met Office yellow rain warning is in place until 1200 on Thurs. https://t.co/YsqTp9cxoX

Our Flood Risk Manager @AndynBrown16 has been in #Croston where we have been operating one of our flood storage basins.

Make sure you sign up for flood warnings here: https://t.co/F1wbUHPZe8

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/ohmPMGkd1L

With heavy rain forecast in the next couple of days, there is a risk of swollen rivers and surface water flooding. Heed the warning from the @EnvAgencyYNE below‚¨áÔ∏è

‚ùå Do not drive or walk through flood water
‚ùå Do not ignore road closure signs put in place for your safety https://t.co/w7jCEvfSL5

@Go_CheshireWest @EnvAgencyNW It's incredibly disappointing that CWaC has not published the section 19 report so lessons can be leant from the previous flood. Is This another example that Northwich us inly an afterthought?

If you or your loved ones live in a flood risk area, check that you know what to do in a flood. Plan ahead by visiting https://t.co/UZvDMo0UK8
#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/QRO949Anjz

Flood alerts on rivers north and west of Oxford. This means high water levels flowing into the #Thames Combined with what's falling out of the sky now, this may cause #ThamesPath to be flooded/very muddy/impassable in places in coming days. 
@EnvAgencySE @RamblersGB @OxTweets https://t.co/Z73o7GQTzg

20 Jan @1026 There are 9 #FloodAlerts in the South East right now as #StormChristoph brings heavy rain. Know what to do in a flood and check your flood risk https://t.co/64gyL62UXF #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/Xnkue4OTLi

@Fareita @RiverMillSchool @Kent_cc @CleanerDartford @guardianeco @KentMessenger @TheSun @DefraGovUK @EnvAgencySE @JonathonHawkes @Dartford_CA @Dartford_Labour @welovedartford Where is this please and I will report for it to be cleaned

tweets.text: We know it will happen, yet we still manage the hills to give them the water absorption capacity of tarmac. Stop burning & stop over-grazing to ensure our hills can absorb these storms. Sandbags are not the answer. @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/d5JSR8Ja5N

tweets.text: @RobStoneman @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts We don't actually have robust evidence to link burning to flooding - most is on eroding/bare peat. Moreover, we also don't know yet what rewetted, completely saturated peatlands do under such conditions (where will water go)? Very important questions to really find answers to.

‚ùó A flood warning has now been issued by the @EnvAgency for Ford Lane/Cheadle Wood following heavy rain (please see map below).
River levels are rising as a result of heavy rainfall associated with Storm Christoph. Flooding to properties in this area is expected
#stormchristoph https://t.co/6SzSGVe0uv

@olylowe @NFUtweets @NFFNUK @EnvAgency @powell_peter @ORFC @DefraWater @Ruralpay @BenGoldsmith @DefraSoils Unlikely. Courts are in crisis. Huge backlog. EA just talking, cajoling, with little effect. It is grim. All over pastoral lowlands. I report but EA officers restricted to quiet chats. Now there's a planning moratorium across 80% of Mendip District. And THIS is why. https://t.co/S6kNItJiGJ

More heavy rain is forecast overnight. Don‚Äôt take any unnecessary risks ‚Äì always avoid flood water. Check the flood risk in your area:  

https://t.co/xNlgwQ9Q4z 

#StormChristoph #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/xHzsaCyYwu

‚ö†Ô∏è Road closures tomorrow for installation of flood defences & pumps:

‚õîÔ∏è 9am - Stourport Road #Bewdley
‚õîÔ∏è 7pm for approx. 4 hours - #Bewdley Bridge
‚õîÔ∏è 7pm for approx. 3 hours - Hylton Road #Worcester 

Please follow local diversions

#StormChristoph https://t.co/jr4JzsIVJ4

@austincwb @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts Argghh. This is exactly what we should not do. We need to slow the flow to stop upland rain ending up in downstream shops, offices and homes. So - keep those gullies clogged up, reduce the flood peak and avoid misery to hundreds of homeowners and businesses.
